Reviews.Title: Superb entry level camera
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a couple of months now and I will start this by saying I am not even close to a professional and never will be.  However, this camera is simply great.  All of these people on here dogging it because of the lens mount or the viewfinder are really just grabbing at straws in my opinion.  This is not marketed as a professional grade camera and unless you are a professional photographer, who is switching lenses dozens of times daily?  I have done several lens swaps and had no problems and after looking at the overall build quality on this camera, I am not worried about the mount wearing out.  I used to have a Nikon D3100 which was great for my needs but I dropped it and ruined the lens and the body so I needed a new one.  I was going to just get another 3100 but decided I'd look around first.  Personally, I love the electronic viewfinder compared to the traditional type found on the rest of the DSLRs on the market.  It makes it easy for an amateur to see exactly what the shot will look like before you take it.  The video quality is second to none.  It is better than the Rebel T5i (my sister owns) and the D5200 (my neighbor owns).  I am going to get an external mic before long to completely get rid of the noise of the auto focus but it is nowhere near as loud or annoying as some would have you believe.  Coming from a Nikon, the controls are slightly different. I wouldn't say better or worse, just different.  I mention this because some people say the controls are not user friendly but I say BS to that as well.  If you learned on something else, you are used to that format and anything different will take some getting used to.  For me, the image quality is better than anything in its class (sub $800).  Even the high ISO pics I have tried gave me less noise than I was ever able to achieve on my old Nikon.  All in all, if you are in the market for and entry level camera and aren't afraid to stand up to all the Nikon and Canon fan boys out there, this camera will surpass your expectations.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected.
Reviews.Author: Grobo
Reviews.Content: This is a feature rich camera.  I have been using SLR film cameras for 20 years and have been reluctant to go digital SLR.  I was concerned that the technology was still not quite capable of reproducing film quality pictures.  But a about 3 years ago I bought a fujifilm f100 and was surprised by the quality of even that small camera.  I finally made the leap this year after I found only one place in town that would process film.  Obviously, that is a dying process.  So when I looked at the reviews, this was was priced well and I am able to use all of my old Minolta lenses. (remember Minolta ha!).  Delivery was prompt, packaging was great,  The above package also includes an extra battery (not Sony branded, but still works fine).  The special package also has an extra air blower from the vendor, which is somewhat unnecessary, since the Sony box also includes one.Ok the good stuff - bottom line is picture are great.  LCD screen is bright, but a little hard to see in bright sunlight.  However, that is about how all LCD screens are.  I was quite impressed with the digital View Finder though.  With moderate lighting or day shots, the VF is barely discernible as being digital.  If feels like I am looking right through a standard DSLR.  It is more apparent in darker settings since the VF is actually producing it's own light, which is ok since you want to see your subject matter.Keep in mind that you really have to read the manual. I tried to figure the setting out and it took me a couple of hours to really understand where things were.  But the manual really lays it out pretty clearly and would have saved me about 1.5 hours.Ultimately pictures are great.  My early 90s Minolta lenses work perfectly although my Minolta 70-210 zoom focuses focuses slightly slower than the new 55-200 Sony lens.  My Minolta 50mm lens though focuses instantly and I didn't notice any lag.  I do prefer the 50mm Minolta lens to the 18-55 though since it has a larger aperture.  Still all the lenses work great and I was able to get some excellent shots.  Overall very pleased

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: Cmark
Reviews.Content: This was a gift and it works very nicely for someone that is not overly familiar for SLR type digital cameras.  The menus are intuitive and quick to learn.  Photo quality is top notch and beyond what might be expected in this price range. The viewfinder is excellent for composing the shot, providing a what you see is what you get environment.  A gem that won't break the budget in a sea of DLSR cameras, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great package deal on Sony DSLR
Reviews.Author: C. Desai
Reviews.Content: Great product, great price. I am happy with the package deal. Once I got the whole package I had everything I needed to get started. Just check the prices of all the products individually and you will know how good a deal this one is.I took this camera on a trip to Lake Tahoe and the pictures turned out beautiful, I love this camera. It's my first DSLR so I can't compare it with other cameras but for a beginner like myself this was a great buy.I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Purchase of Sony Photo package
Reviews.Author: J Durnin
Reviews.Content: Everything is as I expected of a Sony product and that is excellent. The only item that was an excellent product but substandard for the intended use was the carrying case for the equipment. Why include a carrying case that all of the equipment furnished will not fit and will require the purchase of an additional case?I expected a package purchase to be better.

Reviews.Title: OK DSLR and worth your money
Reviews.Author: Gadget wonder
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it is pretty cheap for a DSLR and 55200 lens, it takes amazin photos for its sensor size and with a 2 lens bundle you cannot go wrong!!

Reviews.Title: This is a good camera.
Reviews.Author: MUSHROOM MONTOYA
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera. However, the video comes in MTS format which requires conversion software.The photos are sharp.

Reviews.Title: SLT-A58K
Reviews.Author: CEB
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a gift and I have no reason to believe it will perform any differently from my other 2 Sony DSLR cameras.  The only problem was the wrong extra battery was shipped but I contacted Amazon and they came through with the correct battery.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Belle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for work.  I am not a professional photographer, but do have to take lots of photos at events.  This camera is light weight and takes great pictures.  One day I might even know how to use all of its functions.

Reviews.Title: love this Camera. With room to be creative or just point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Bourgoin "stilup"
Reviews.Content: Always wanted a real camera. picked up some gear to compliment the camera, Now for the fun stiff.Also to help learn I purchased a book on it to help this amature.Everthing works just great and I love the fact that it can focus because I don't see like I used to.Taking movies is a breeze. I want to learn the fine adjustments and settings and the misses just wants to pick it up and shoot.Well, best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: David H Helsel
Reviews.Content: Disappointed that I missed out on the Nikon d3200 Black Friday deal until now.....This camera is great. Has a setting for newbies that produces execellent pictures. Movies are excellent. They are clear. I shot in low light and they are all good. Red eye shows up some...need to figure out how to get rid of that.....I am very happy with my choice.. I have not tried the 55-200 lens yet. Focus camera is great. Image stablization works super too....There is absolutely no comparison to my Nikon point and shoot or camcorder....This is better than both of them by a huge margin.

Reviews.Title: My sister loves the camera, but hated the third party seller
Reviews.Author: Susan J. Rea
Reviews.Content: My sister really likes Sony cameras, she has the A55V and uses it all the time.  i wanted to get her an updated camera but couldn't find a  bundle like this one for the A65, plus the camera was newer.  Well she loves the A58 and the extra lens, but a few things were wrong or missing.  Forst, no Sony camera, while that is not a deal breaker that is supposed to be part of this bundle.  Also the battery is a Vivatar and does not charge in the Sony charger, in fact the Sony battery is 7.2v 11.5Wh, 1600mAh, while the Vivitar is 7.4V 1800mAh 13.3Wh. Quite a difference and when she put the Vivitar in the charger all it did was blink and never charged.  Lastly the SD card was not a Sony as shown in the photos. it is some crazy off brand called Bandwidth which neither of us could find any information on.  A call to Amazon lead nowhere, just return it for a refund and reorder the bundle.  What to receive the same things again?  The camera works, she is happy but beware of Focus Camera because what you see is not at all what you get as far as the accessories go.

Reviews.Title: Missing Items From Package
Reviews.Author: Kasia Kozak
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera and was planning on using it for an upcoming trip that I am going on. However, upon the camera's arrival I noticed that the Sony carrying case that was listed as coming with the package and that was shown in the picture was not in the box. I would hope that for the amount of money I spent on this package, that Focus Camera would be able to include everything they promised in the package. It would be greatly appreciated if Focus Camera would fulfill their end of the deal by shipping the camera bag to me, and if they do so I will change this review to reflect such actions. Until then I would encourage any perspective buyers of thinking twice before buying from this vendor

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: Mommy Two
Reviews.Content: A bit bummed out. Based on the positive reviews, I believe I got a defective camera because the LCD screen displayed a distorted live images. Bummed out however planning on purchasing another one

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Cricket1969
Reviews.Content: This camera was recommended to me by a photographer friend of mine.  The delivery was very quick and the camera is fantastic.  It takes wonderful pictures.  I'd like to get an additional lens for it, but this is a wonderful get started package!  Couldn't be more pleased.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Best Decision
Reviews.Author: James Drain
Reviews.Content: Got this camera today and I've already fell in love with it. Everything came perfect and in order. Haven't tried other stuff but the lenses and camera. They are both Sony brand and work perfect. Best decision I've made between Sony and Canon. Already compared pictures with my friend who has a Canon and my pictures are coming out clearer and crisper then what he is taking and the shutter speed I can pick up fast moving objects without troubles. Only downfall is the bag is a camcorder bag rather than a DSLR bag and you can't fit the camera in it.

Reviews.Title: SONY A58 BUNDLE KIT
Reviews.Author: daniel lopez
Reviews.Content: Purchased this bundle kit and was completly satisfied. All I can say is this camera &  lens kit are amazing. This is my first DSLR as I was looking for a hobby for when I retire but couldn't wait till then. The only complaint I have was HDMI cable that came with it wasn't the right one for this camera. I know this was supplied by SONY and not the fault of the vendor. I called AMAZON and thier Cust svc rep. gave me credit to order the appropiate cable Great service.

Reviews.Title: Best DSLR Camera I've Owned
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I've used cannon and Nikon DSLR Cameras and neither one work as well as this one. I love the price and what comes. The Camera Itself works amazingly. And it came a day early. the one problem I had with this bundle is the camera bag is too small to hold both lenses with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good bundle deal, everything needed to get started - case is the only fail of the bundle
Reviews.Author: Coffeemamallama "1stmamallama"
Reviews.Content: I have never had a DSLR, my camera up until now has been my trusted Minolta SRT102 with a lovely collection of lenses, collected over 20 years and a lovely little Rolliecord of about 1955 era that I inherited from my dad.  I have taken and sold many wonderful photos over the years, including weddings, family photos and grads shots, with these cameras but digital is the standard now, so I decided that as I move toward retirement I would make the switch.  I am also excited to see this will work with some of the old Minolta/Konica Maxxum lenses I have but never used, since I never had a camera body that would use them.This is a pretty decent camera body.  It is simple and light weight.  Some photographers will not care for how light weight, but I know some older folks that will really appreciate this.  I also like how it fits in my palm so well (I have smaller hands) while still allowing me to easily utilize manual focus options of the lenses.  I am still getting used to the idea of an ISO button, instead of a F ring, transfer to digital is otherwise pretty flawless.  The auto functions make standard family and travel snapshots a breeze, you will get good exposure and color memories with little preset effort.  I have other preferences, so I will utilize this less I suspect.The lenses that come with this are more then adequate for a hobbiest or beginner.  Luckily there are some nicer lenses A bayonet lenses produced by Sony, I am sure I will be buy at least a couple more, but for the price this is a heck of pack.I have to say, the only down was the camera case.  What got is for a Sony Camcorder, doesn't even begin to fit the body and lenses purchased in this pack.  I will be reselling it as quick as I can and purchasing a nice backpack style with room for lenses shortly.  I have not shot more than some test video, looks and sounds good on my Samsung smart tv, not much else to add on that just yet.  I did also buy the remote button, glad I did.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: blaxrs
Reviews.Content: LOTS of stuff, all seems to be good, and everything came quickly, which was really nice. I'm enjoying using my new camera.

Reviews.Title: The best
Reviews.Author: Jermeldaise
Reviews.Content: The best camera bundle around, anyone who shoots nikkon or canon cant understand the level of image quality sony has over them. Its a fact sony makes the best image sensors in every iphone,nikon,and canon around. with a sony dslr you cant go wrong, the screen is cheap but the viewfinder is one of the best in the world! its crazy fast in video and makes and semi pro a master of imagery!

Reviews.Title: It`s unbelievable!!!
Reviews.Author: atanasgakov
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera and i`m happy that bought this camera and all with in. It`s incredible package for me.

Reviews.Title: This is one DOG of a  camera
Reviews.Author: Clay Western
Reviews.Content: Lasted one week and then flat out quit.  Took it to an authorized SONY repair outlet.  They said electrical problem.  Returned it to Amazon for a full refund and ordered an Canon Rebel package.  Bummer.  Avoid it.

ProductInfo.Name: Sony SLT-A58K SLT-A58 with 18-55mm Zoom Lens, 20.1MP DSLR Camera w/ 2.7" LCD Screen (Black) + Sony SAL-552002 DT 55-200mm f/4-5.6 Telephoto Lens + Sony 32GB Memory Card + Sony Small System Case + Accessory Kit
